alert.note: Alert for Roane (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 5:57PM CDT until August 06 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Anderson, Knox and Roane. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 655 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain due to thunderstorms had ended. Minor flooding is still possible due to runoff in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen across parts of the area. - Some locations that may still experience flooding include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Clinton, Farragut, Oliver Springs, Louisville, Norris, Karns and Andersonville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
